Key Match Events: DJ Herz held the Pirates without a hit through five innings in the Nationals' 5-3 win over the Pirates.
Reliever Robert García carried the no-hit bid into the seventh inning before relinquishing a two-out single to Nick Gonzales.
Herz finished with five strikeouts to three walks on 87 pitches.

Herz's final strikeout was a swinging strike three on a four-seamer well into the other batter’s box, the second-farthest four-seamer out of the zone to induce a swing from a left-handed pitcher this season.
Post-Match Reflections: Pirates manager Derek Shelton praised Herz for varying the speeds of his fastball and doing a nice job at the top of the zone.
Herz credited his changeup for his performance, stating it was one of the better days it’s been all year.
Closer Kyle Finnegan expressed enjoyment in watching Herz pitch, saying 'He’s fun to watch.'
Herz reflected on his progress, noting the importance of staying in the zone and having confidence in his pitching.
